item.title: Recycling bins for apartments at 90 Whiston Road are overflowing, 4th January
item.description:
The recycling bins in the bin room used by residents of 90 Whiston Road haven't been emptied in about 2 weeks now. They're completely overflowing and have been way since a week ago.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip / overflowing public bin on Montrave Road, 4th January
item.description:
In addition to the flytip and overflowing bin, dog poo bags have also been stuffed behind the bin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light pole in front of 4 Cleve road, 4th January
item.description:
The street light that is in front of 4 Cleve Road, or across the road from 5 Cleve Road(where I stay), creates so much light pollution in my bedroom and has been affecting my sleep for couple of months now.I have tried using jet black curtains but I can not cover the whole window as I also need daylight during the day.In the previous section I have attached a picture of my bedroom which shows the light pollution at night.I was wondering if it would be possible install shades on the light in order to dim it a little bit.Continuous nights of poor sleep has affected my mental health as well creating sleep anxiety.Any help will be appreceated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Cleve Road, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two unowned big black bins, 4th January
item.description:
There are two big black bins left on the pavement that haven’t been claimed by anyone or any home. They’re taking up space on the pavement and need to be removed, thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak frozen - slip hazard, 4th January
item.description:
There is a water leak on the pavement. It is now frozen covering the whole pavement. Pedestrians forced to tread dangerous path or walk in road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30-40 inch pot on Denmark Hill by street lighting #251142, 4th January
item.description:
There are multiple pot holes and what seems to look like water in the road from a blocked drain. Water is covering a pot At the end of Ferndene Road, leading onto Denmark hill that is where the pot hole is located. I noticed the issue when it pierced my tyre at around 1:00am on 4/01/2026 I logged this last night but was unable to gather any photos as I needed to drive the car to a safe location before my tyre fully deflated. The reference for this is - FixMyStreet ref: 8622338.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-36, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rectory Place - litter pick required, 4th January
item.description:
There is rubbish and dead leaves everywhere. These tickets keep immediately getting closed down and marked as ‘fixed’ when they are not. I have taken a screenshot of this. This part of Greenwich simply does not get the time, care and attention the Council provide in central Greenwich.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): FP82, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Continuous water leaking onto pavement on Montpelier Way, 4th January
item.description:
For some reason water is always leaking from under a fence onto the pavement on Montpelier Way. In normal times it is dangerously slippery - both my partner and I have slipped over trying to walk along the pavement here - but in freezing conditions it could be lethal. This has been the case for months if not years. Can something be done about it please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpelier Way, Brent Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
